PRESENTING INFORMATION

In English

Estimated time: 5 - 20 minutes (depending on level of skill and interest)

What do you have to do and why?

In this task you must present numeric and graphical information in English. Follow the steps below:

  1. Think of a good question to ask that can be answered with numbers or a graph like this pie chart or this bar chart. For example:
    • What is the most popular TV series or movie in your class?
    • What careers or studies will your classmates persue after graduation?
    • 5 students have been to France; 1 to Germany; 2 to Malta; 4 to England; 1 to the U.S.; 1 to Australia; etc.

    For more ideas you may ask your classmates or your teacher (I can always think of something) or explore one of my favorite forums: /r/dataisbeautiful

  2. Think about how you are going to ask this question and collect the information. Say you want to know who has been to what country. Everytime you hear a new country, write it down and mark it like this: Belgium I. As you go around maybe you learn that 2 more students have been to Belgium so you should now have written down: Belgium III
  3. Go ahead and begin your survey by asking questions in the way you just planned. Use the Country example above to tally scores (Beglium has a tally of 3: Belgium III)
  4. The tricky part: enter this information into a spreadsheet. In one column should be one value (ie. Belgium), and in another column should be a numerical value (ie. III). This can be done in less than 2 minutes with Microsoft Excel. If you do not have Excel, you can use the free version online or with a spreadsheet app on a mobile device, however these may not enable you to do the next task (making a graph). For that you may need the help of a friend, the school's computer, or by downloading an open source alternative such as LibreOffice, which is free AND you have the option of challenging yourself even more if you decide to install it in English (reccomended for anyone in B2 or higher).
  5. The even trickier part: making a graph. If you already know how to do this then great news - you have an easy homework assignment. If not, this is a good listening or reading plus thinking in English exercise by following a tutorial (Google or YouTube). You'll have to turn that information on your spread sheet into something visible for everyone to see and understand in an instant. Like a pie chart or bar graph (as we saw before)
  6. You will have to present your graph in front of the class so once your satisfied with it, print it out and think about what you are going to say. A good idea is write a quick summary (just 1 to 4 sentences is enough) of your project. You may also send me your chart by submitting it on the moodle platform.

Go ahead and get started. If you think this activity is a dumb waste of time, see below:

Why do this? Several reasons, really:

  • It's an interactive activity that challenges you to think critically and in English.
  • You will learn how to make presentations in English
  • Many students need to know how to do this task if they are taking a higher level exam such TOEFL/TOEIC, CAE, CPE, the SAT, and, quite infamously, IELTS Writing Task 1.
  • You'll probably have to use these skills if you study at a university. If you study in a country that speaks English, you MUST know how to do this, even if you are going to a highshool. (my elementary school had us learning them when we were 11 years old!)
  • If you want to persue studies or a career in Business, STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics), and even various areas of law, you will need these skills.
  • Most importantly: it is the year 2017: we are in the Information Age. Everyone should know how to read data and interperate data on a basic level.

Still not convinced you should do this? Congratulations! I have a writing assignment for you as an alternative. Chances are you have an exam that may ask you to write a persuasive essay, or you'll need to write something convincing one day for work like a sales pitch or business proposal. Your assignment is to write a letter to your teacher explaining to him in about 80 to 100 words why you think this assignment is a waste of time. Good luck! (and don't forget to plan before and proof read at least twice)
